intro: Acetosella polytricha, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of small, hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acetosella polytricha is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
